natural solution: Multiply both numerator and denominator by $\sqrt7$: \begin{align} \frac1{2\sqrt7} &= \frac1{2\sqrt7}\cdot\frac{\sqrt7}{\sqrt7}\\ &= \boxed{\frac{\sqrt7}{14}}. \end{align}
